header_summary:
Scott Beeker's analysis underscores the urgency of transitioning Bitcoin to a post-quantum cryptographic standard like SLH-DSA to mitigate the risks posed by quantum computing developments. This transition, however, presents substantial challenges, including increased key and signature sizes impacting transaction throughput and network bandwidth, necessitating a hard fork and extensive updates to Bitcoin wallet software. Despite these hurdles, the move towards SLH-DSA is deemed crucial for ensuring Bitcoin's long-term security against quantum threats, albeit with concerns over increased centralization and the complexity of executing such a change. Valuable insights and further discussions on this topic can be found at [Trail of Bits Blog](https://blog.trailofbits.com/2024/08/15/we-wrote-the-code-and-the-code-won/), [SLH-DSA GitHub Repository](https://github.com/slh-dsa/sloth), [Latacora Blog on Post-Quantum Cryptography](https://www.latacora.com/blog/2024/07/29/crypto-right-answers-pq/), and an article on quantum computing's breakthroughs at [CSO Online](https://www.csoonline.com/article/3562701/chinese-researchers-break-rsa-encryption-with-a-quantum-computer.html/amp).

Weiji Guo introduces significant advancements in blockchain efficiency and scalability through the integration of zero-knowledge proofs (ZKPs) with zkStark technology and aggregated IPA, targeting proof size reduction and verification time acceleration. This approach, while enhancing transaction speed and security, also introduces a threshold mechanism to maintain inclusivity among miners of varying computational capacities, ensuring the blockchain's scalability and efficiency. For more collaborative discussions and feedback, Guo has shared a live document on GitHub at [https://github.com/opzkp/tea-horse](https://github.com/opzkp/tea-horse).

Accumulator presents the concept of "Bundled Payments" within the BOLT12 specification, aiming to facilitate non-custodian exchanges by creating invoices for separate preimages and amounts. This innovation addresses challenges in submarine swaps and Just-In-Time channels, enhancing transaction efficiency and security. Technical specifications and detailed discussions on this proposal are accessible through the Linux Foundation's mailing list at [this link](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/lightning-dev/2023-June/003977.html) and [another page](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/lightning-dev/2023-June/003990.html), offering valuable resources for developers and stakeholders interested in blockchain transaction improvements.

recent_posts.title: Hardforking Bitcoin to SLH-DSA (Future Proofing)
recent_posts.summary:
- Transitioning Bitcoin to SLH-DSA aims to protect against quantum computing threats.
- Adopting SLH-DSA presents challenges like bigger key sizes and consensus issues.
- Despite difficulties, SLH-DSA ensures Bitcoin's long-term security against quantum attacks.

recent_posts.title: OP_ZKP updates
recent_posts.summary:
- Zero-knowledge proofs in blockchain transactions see improvements for efficiency and scalability.
- A threshold value T ensures scalability by limiting OP_ZKP transactions for all miners.
- A new approach enables collective verification of transactions exceeding the threshold through block proofs.

recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine discusses the intricacies of testing lightning vulnerabilities, especially dust output inflation.
- Testing requires understanding lightning and bitcoind setups, needing significant expertise and time.
- He mentions an old gist on transaction-relay jamming, highlighting an overlooked vulnerability.

recent_posts.title: Expanding on BOLT12
recent_posts.summary:
- The email details the introduction of "Bundled Payments" to BOLT12.
- It aims to support transactions with two preimages and amounts for mining fees.
- Links to the Linux Foundation provide in-depth discussions and technical specs.

recent_posts.title: CVE-2024-38365 public disclosure (btcd `FindAndDelete` bug)
recent_posts.summary:
- `FindAndDelete` modifies a copy of the script for sighash commitment without altering its execution.
- The function removes stack elements post `OP_CHECKSIG` or `OP_CHECKMULTISIG`, targeting specific elements.
- Misunderstandings about `removeOpcodeByData` clarified, with insights on `OP_CODESEPARATOR` shared privately.

recent_posts.title: Anonymous discount coupons using chaumian ecash
recent_posts.summary:
- Recent conference discussed ecash's innovative uses, like privacy-enhancing discount coupons.
- Ecash enables gifting via cryptographic operations without needing bitcoin deposits.
- This approach fosters community engagement and enhances privacy in digital transactions.

active_posts.title: Demonstrating Pinning Attacks under Real-World Conditions
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine proposes "free-to-pwn" nodes for real-world attack demonstrations on Bitcoin's network.
- The initiative invites participants to showcase attack techniques, aiming for public assessment of protocol security.
- It critiques inadequate safety claims and promotes transparency by verifying attacks under genuine conditions.

active_posts.title: OP_ZKP updates
active_posts.summary:
- The OP_ZKP proposal integrates Zero-Knowledge Proofs in Bitcoin, focusing on an apt proving scheme.
- Security, minimal block size, and batched verification are crucial for the selected ZKP scheme.
- Future adoption may consider alternatives like Dory if issues with IPA are unresolved.

active_posts.title: Hardforking Bitcoin to SLH-DSA (Future Proofing)
active_posts.summary:
- Transitioning Bitcoin to SLH-DSA aims to protect against quantum computing threats.
- The shift involves large key sizes, impacting Bitcoin's transaction capacity and fees.
- Despite challenges, SLH-DSA ensures Bitcoin's security against quantum attacks but requires consensus.

active_posts.title: Ecash TIDES using Cashu and Stratum v2
active_posts.summary:
- Integrating BDHKE into Stratum v2 enhances privacy and auditability for small payouts.
- The BDHKE mechanism involves a two-step process for valid share submissions by miners.
- The proposal suggests utilizing Cashu for improved transaction efficiency and exploring ASIC use.

active_posts.title: SuperScalar: Laddered Timeout-Tree-Structured Decker-Wattenhofer Factories
active_posts.summary:
- The SuperScalar mechanism offers a solution to Bitcoin's Last-Mile Problem by improving offchain liquidity allocation.
- It combines Decker-Wattenhofer mechanisms, timeout trees, and laddering to enhance security and scalability.
- The approach aims for practical deployment, focusing on incentivizing user activity and efficient liquidity management.

active_posts.title: Unspendable keys in descriptors
active_posts.summary:
- Integration of miniscript with taproot enhances Bitcoin Core, posing new challenges for developers.
- Approaches to generating indistinguishable and unique unspendable keys have varying trade-offs.
- Recycling descriptor entropy emerges as a promising but complex solution for wallet policy standardization.

today_in_history_posts.title: Transaction Input/Output Sorting
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Wallet transaction sortings reveal boundaries due to preferences for deterministic sorting.
- Some wallets oppose deterministic sorting, concerned about privacy loss and incompatibility.
- A proposed solution involves deterministic sorting with a semi-secret for external randomness.

today_in_history_posts.title: RFC: simplifications and suggestions on open/accept limits.
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Gert-Jaap opposes removing htlc_minimum_msat, citing it prevents trimmed HTLCs.
- He suggests adjustments to dust definition and proposes chain-specific minimum_depth.
- Rusty agrees on chain-dependent minimum_depth but not on opting out of sub-1000 msat parts.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin aims for 1 billion users with 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for transactions.
- High transaction costs propel the use of semi-trusted, interconnected off-chain entities.
- Development focuses on enhancing security, scalability, and regulatory compliance of these entities.
